hero.title: About Us
hero.subtitle: Learn about our passion for showcasing the beauty of Rwanda

story.title: Our Story
story.content1: GWINO UREBE URWANDA RWIZA was founded with a simple mission: to share the incredible beauty and rich culture of Rwanda with the world. Our name, which translates to "Come and See Beautiful Rwanda," embodies our commitment to providing authentic and immersive experiences.
story.content2: Our team consists of passionate local guides who have deep knowledge of Rwanda's history, wildlife, and traditions. We believe that tourism should benefit local communities and contribute to conservation efforts, which is why we work closely with local partners and support sustainable practices.
story.content3: Whether you're interested in gorilla trekking, exploring the stunning landscapes, or immersing yourself in Rwandan culture, we are dedicated to creating unforgettable experiences that showcase the best of our beautiful country.

hero.title: Cultural Experiences
hero.subtitle: Immerse yourself in Rwanda's rich cultural heritage

intro.title: Discover Rwandan Culture
intro.content1: Rwanda's cultural heritage is as diverse and beautiful as its landscapes. From traditional dance and music to handicrafts, cuisine, and community experiences, there are countless ways to immerse yourself in Rwandan culture.
intro.content2: Our cultural experiences are designed to provide authentic interactions with local communities, supporting traditional practices while offering visitors meaningful insights into Rwandan life and traditions.

testimonials.title: What Our Clients Say
testimonials.subtitle: Hear from travelers who have experienced Rwandan culture with us

cta.title: Ready to Experience Rwandan Culture?
cta.subtitle: Book a cultural experience or include cultural activities in your custom tour

culturalExperiences.heroSubtitle: Immerse yourself in the rich traditions, art, and cuisine of Rwanda through unforgettable experiences.
culturalExperiences.introText1: Rwanda is a land of vibrant traditions, where every dance, craft, and dish tells a story of resilience and unity.
culturalExperiences.introText2: Join us on a journey to uncover the heart of Rwanda through its cultural experiences, connecting with its people and heritage.
culturalExperiences.testimonialsSubtitle: Hear from travelers who have experienced the magic of Rwanda's culture.
culturalExperiences.testimonial1: The traditional dance performance was breathtaking! I felt so connected to the history and spirit of Rwanda.
culturalExperiences.testimonial2: Learning to weave baskets with local artisans was such a rewarding experience. I’ll cherish the memories forever.
culturalExperiences.testimonial3: Sharing a meal with a Rwandan family was the highlight of my trip. Their warmth and hospitality were unforgettable.
culturalExperiences.ctaSubtitle: Book your cultural adventure today and create memories that will last a lifetime.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Find answers to common questions about traveling in Rwanda

bestTime.question: What is the best time to visit Rwanda?
bestTime.answer: Rwanda can be visited year-round. The dry seasons (June to September and December to February) are ideal for gorilla trekking and wildlife viewing. The wet seasons offer lush landscapes and are less crowded.

visa.question: Do I need a visa to visit Rwanda?
visa.answer: Most visitors can obtain a visa on arrival or apply online through the Rwanda Immigration website. Citizens of some countries are exempt from visa requirements. We recommend checking the latest visa information before your trip.

gorillaTrekking.question: How much does gorilla trekking cost?
gorillaTrekking.answer: Gorilla trekking permits cost $1,500 per person for foreign non-residents. This includes park entrance fees and a guided trek. We handle all permit arrangements for our clients.

safety.question: Is Rwanda safe for tourists?
safety.answer: Rwanda is considered one of the safest countries in Africa. It has low crime rates, stable governance, and excellent infrastructure. As with any destination, normal travel precautions should be observed.

languages.question: What languages are spoken in Rwanda?
languages.answer: The official languages are Kinyarwanda, English, French, and Swahili. English is widely spoken in tourist areas, and our guides are fluent in English.
